9.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
9.title: "Also Her High Hat"
9.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The whole gang is at the swank Northridge Hotel, including Hilda.

10.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
10.title: "Another Shock"
10.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard wants Westgate to drive by Hilda's house and honk, but then Hilda passes them in another limousine.

11.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
11.title: "In the Clouds"
11.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda and June discuss the 'no females allowed' attitude of the fraternity guys, and then Freckles and Lard pointedly ignore them.

12.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
12.title: "Man the Boats"
12.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda tells Lard to go back to woman-hating, and Hilda's dad douses lard with a pitcher of water.

13.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
13.title: "On Deaf Ears"
13.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard try to convince Hilda and June that TWIRP Season was not their idea.

14.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
14.title: "On Thin Ice"
14.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda Grubble and June Wayman introduce themselves to Pat Owen, the new girl, and begin to explain Woman-Hating Week.

15.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
15.title: "So Long Chump!"
15.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard shows up on Hilda's doorstep and is rebuffed; she's a woman-hater now: A woman who hates wasting time on him.

16.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
16.title: "Some Fun"
16.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: June and Hilda express their resolve not to make any dates during TWIRP Season, and end up deciding to go the cemetery and watch snails.

17.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
17.title: "Stuck Again!"
17.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: TWIRP Season starts at noon and lasts 15 days; Hilda runs up a bill at 9 AM and hands it to Lard. "Call me up in about fifteen days," she says.

18.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
18.title: "Three Guesses"
18.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Eight AM, still Woman-Hating Week, and no boys anywhere. Hilda and June think to ask Pat Owen.

19.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
19.title: "Two of a Kind"
19.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda an June want Lard and Freck to step in puddles so the girls will know how deep they are.

20.heading: Grubble, Hilda.
20.title: "Water Cure"
20.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda's father plans an amphibious assault on the skirt patrol at his front window.

42.heading: Grubert, Major.
42.title: "Nothing Much"
42.author: by Moebius
42.series: The Airtight Garage of Jerry Cornelius ; 16th episode
42.appears_in: p. 15-18 in Heavy Metal, v. 2, no. 5 (Sept. 1978).
notes: "Story to date: As he walked along the runway at the little airport of Obeant, accompanied by his favorite Choelem, Major Grubert had a sort of vision. With the help of thirteen generators especially constructed for the purpose, Grubert (who had filed the patent just the day before) could transform any old asteroid, lost anywhere in the beyond, into an enormous and complex world, such as was needed on several levels. The following events proved him right. It was not until much later that he met Malvina."
"To be continued."

52.heading: Grudge Matches.
52.title: "The Fight For the Right To Be Superman!"
52.author: Paul Kupperberg, writer ; Irv Novick, penciller ; Dave Hunt, inker ; Gaspar Saladino, letterer ; Gene d'Angelo, colorist ; Julius Schwartz, editor
notes: Summary (by Mary Walker): A wrestler dreams he beats Superman in a bout to determine who could be called Superman, a grudge match because Moe Ramboe had billed himself as Superman in the ring before Superman came along. Moe has a habit of having prophetic dreams, or affective dreams. His brother, a hood who sees a way to profit from this one, gathers together the heads of the Metropolis mobs and introduces Moe as the man who can beat Superman. At the same time Superman finds that his super-strength ebbs and flows, sometimes present but at other times embarassingly absent. Finally he has a compulsion to go to the arena where Moe is waiting for the fight, which ends as he dreamed it. Superman recovers for the rematch, finds that both his strength and invulnerability have returned and Moe is beaten. He tells Superman about the dreams.

101.heading: Das Grüne Blatt.
101.title: "Die Tiny-Winys : eine Ableger der Hegen-Schule"
101.author: von Gerd Lettkemann
notes: Begins: "In der bundesweit vertriebenen Wochen-Postille Das Grüne Blatt erschien 1961 der grossformatige Farb-Strip 'Die Tiny-Winys'. Stilistisch ist er der Hegen-Schule zuzuordnen, zum Teil kaum zu unterscheiden von vergleichbaren, in Ost-Berlin produzierten Seiten des 'Mosaik von Hannes Hegen'. Obwohl anonym veröffentlicht, ist mit Sicherheit von einer Urheberschaft aus dem Kreis des 'Mosaik'-Kollektivs auszugehen, zumal eine Figur im Comic als Abbild eines 'Mosaik"-Mitarbeiters erkennbar ist."
Includes bibliographical references and illustrations.

109.heading: Grünewald, Dietrich, 1947-
109.title: "Sigenot, ein Daumenkino des Mittelalters?"
109.author: von Dietrich Grünewald
notes: Begins: "Aus moderner Perspektive stellen sich Zeugnisse vergangener Jahrhunderte oft anders dar, als sie in ihrer Zeit möglicherweise intendiert waren. Lässt sich Ludwig Henfflins 'Sigenot' von 1475 als enge Bildfolge, quasi als ein Daumenkino lesen? Eine nähere Betrachtung spricht dagegen."

111.heading: Grünewald, Dietrich, 1947- --Miscellanea.
111.title: "Comic : Kunst"
111.author: von Eckart Sackmann
notes: Begins: "In Koblenz wurde in diesem Sommer ein repräsentabler Querschnitt durch di Geschichte des deutschen Comic im 20. Jahrhundert gezeigt, eine in Konzept und Zusammenstellung einmalige Ausstellung. Begleitend hatte der Initiator der Schau, Prof. Dr. Dietrich Grünewald, zu einer Expertentagung geladen."
Illustrations include photographs of Heiner Jancke and Eckart Sackmann.
